channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17044] Fix merge failed before creating merged region leaves meta inconsistent
item.description: Similar to HBASE-16093. Rollback from failed merge should not offline the target region for the merge if it hasn't been created.
item.summary: Fix merge failed before creating merged region leaves meta inconsistent

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
WIP patch for branch-1.2.
Testing

The idea looks good:


+	    // Only offline the merging region if it is known to exist.

+	    if (rs_p != null) {

	      regionOffline(p);	

+	    }

I check the code in branch-1.1 - this logic also missing. So we should put this change in both branch-1 and all branch-1.x

A side note: Since this logic is missing in all 1.x, we still don't know the root cause of ITBLL failing in split/merge area in 1.2, but not in 1.1.

Maybe it's premature to say either this is a root cause or not. And, there is more than one issue in 1.2 - recall the RPC priority problem of the other month - that could contribute to a latent bug becoming more visible.
The ITBLL test I've been running just finished/failed. This change isn't the fix (although may be a good idea). Let me look at the cluster logs tomorrow.

Any concerns about committing this change? I will patch 1.1 and up unless objection.

I am opening a new JIRA to track down the root cause further.
Looks good to me. Thanks, Andrew
Patch for master
branch-1 patch applies to 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3
Tests look good locally, going to commit shortly unless objection

-1 overall
